net.kreatious.pianoleopard.midi.event

Class NoteEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kreatious.pianoleopard.midi.event.Event
      • net.kreatious.pianoleopard.midi.event.NoteEvent

  • public class NoteEvent
extends Event
    Represents a note on or off event that is associated with a particular key (note) number.
    Author:
    Jay-R Studer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NoteEvent(int key, boolean on, long time)
      Constructs a new NoteEvent with the specified data.

      Creates a new off event of the same type and slot with the specified timestamp.

      Returns the note number associated with this event.

      Gets a slot that uniquely identifies which interval events belong to.

      Returns the velocity associated with this event.
      boolean isOn()
      Gets if this event is an off to on transition.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NoteEvent

        public NoteEvent(int key,
                 boolean on,
                 long time)
        Constructs a new NoteEvent with the specified data.

        The channel will be 0 and velocity will be 127.

        Parameters:
        key - the raw MIDI key (note) for this event, between 0 and 127 inclusive
        on - true if this event is a note on event, otherwise false
        time - the time that this event occurs, in microseconds

    • Method Detail

      • getKey

        public int getKey()
        Returns the note number associated with this event.

        MIDI note numbers range from 0 to 127, inclusive. Note C4 is number 60.

        Returns:
        the raw key (note) number associated with this event

      • getVelocity

        public int getVelocity()
        Returns the velocity associated with this event.

        Velocity ranges from 0 to 127, inclusive.

        Returns:
        the velocity (loudness) associated with this event.

      • isSharp

        public boolean isSharp()
        Returns if this note is considered sharp or not.
        Returns:
        true if this note event is a sharp note, false otherwise.

      • isOn

        public boolean isOn()
        Description copied from class: Event
        Gets if this event is an off to on transition.

        Note that an event can transition from off to on multiple times before an on to off transition occurs.

        Specified by:
        isOn in class Event
        Returns:
        true if this event marks the start of an interval, false otherwise

      • getSlot

        public Slot getSlot()
        Description copied from class: Event
        Gets a slot that uniquely identifies which interval events belong to.

        Equal slots are events occurring for the same channel and key.

        Specified by:
        getSlot in class Event
        Returns:
        a uniquely identifying slot for this event

      • createOff

        public NoteEvent createOff(long offTime)
        Description copied from class: Event
        Creates a new off event of the same type and slot with the specified timestamp.
        Specified by:
        createOff in class Event
        Parameters:
        offTime - the off time of the created event measured in microseconds
        Returns:
        a new event that is off but with the specified timestamp
